abstract: Today’s automated stock exchanges are fast and efficient, so long as the computers are working. When things go awry, chaos can emerge quickly.
snippet: Today’s automated stock exchanges are fast and efficient, so long as the computers are working. When things go awry, chaos can emerge quickly.
lead_paragraph: A generation ago, when the stock market crashed on Oct. 19, 1987, the Nasdaq stock market appeared to have done much better than the New York Stock Exchange. While the Dow Jones industrial average fell 23 percent that day, the Nasdaq composite index was off just 11 percent.

headline.main: In Markets’ Tuned-Up Machinery, Stubborn Ghosts Remain
headline.print_headline: In Markets’ Tuned-Up Machinery, Stubborn Ghosts Remain
